description: A square temple in a temenos located on a low hill beside the river Stort. Lewis (1966) suggests a chronology ranging from the mid to late 3rd CE and ending in the late 4th or early 5th CE, but it now seems that it was a late Iron Age shrine succeeded by a masonry temple in the 80s CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Harlow (Essex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Smith, Alex. “The Fate of Pagan Temples in Sount-East Britain during the Late and Post-Roman Periods.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
